taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Found in extreme environments, from anoxic conditions (slack water zones bordered by dense vegetation) (Ref. 35381) to  slightly turbid but free flowing streams (Ref. 11225).  When its biotope becomes dry, it can move pout of the water, due to its ability to breathe intestinally, in order to find another aquatic environment (Ref. 35381).  Feeds at night on fish, insects and plant matter (Ref. 7020).  Juveniles feed on rotifers, in addition to the micro-crustaceans and aquatic insect larvae they find when digging into the substrate (Ref. 35381).  During reproduction, the male's belly turns orange and its pectoral spines become longer and thicker.  The male builds a bubble nest with some floating plants, strongly guarding it after the female lays down her eggs (up to 120) (Ref. 35381).  Aquarium keeping:  in groups of 5 or more individuals; minimum aquarium size 120 cm (Ref. 51539).
dataObjects.references: Burgess, W.E. 1989 An atlas of freshwater and marine catfishes. A preliminary survey of the Siluriformes. T.F.H. Publications, Inc., Neptune City, New Jersey (USA). 784 p. (Ref. 6868)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Most Cis-Andean South American river drainages north of Buenos Aires, Argentina.
dataObjects.references: Reis, R.E. 2003 Callichthyidae (Armored catfishes). p. 291-309. In R.E. Reis, S.O. Kullander and C.J. Ferraris, Jr. (eds.) Checklist of the Freshwater Fishes of South and Central America. Porto Alegre: EDIPUCRS, Brasil. (Ref. 37395)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 17.0 cm SL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 81048)); max. published weight: 80.0 g (Ref. 79585)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: demersal; freshwater; pH range: 5.8 - 8.3; dH range: 0 - 30

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Builds a nest of air bubbles coated with saliva on the underside of a large leaf. Eggs are attached to the nest and are guarded by the male. Eggs hatch in 4 to 6 days.

Life stage: unsexed
Note:
Location: Guyana, Essequibo River
Canon Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XTi

dataObjects.title: File:Callichthys callichthys.JPG
dataObjects.description: Spanish: 1=El pez denominado cascarudo (Callichthys callichthys). English: 1=The cascarudo, armored catfish, bubblenest catfish, hassar, or mailed catfish (Callichthys callichthys). Portuguese: 1=O tambuatá ou tamuatá (Callichthys callichthys).
